intro: Sonchus oreophilus, commonly known as the mountain sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a radiate pattern. Sonchus oreophilus is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, humid conditions.
